Can any filter pro give a clean proof of the following (or is it already in mathlib?):
I just managed to prove that the interior of a finite product equals the product of the interiors, but it's possibly one of the ugliest Lean proofs I've ever written and I'm not sure I understand it to be quite honest.
P.S. I was surprised to note the forward direction interior (pi I s) ‚äÜ I.pi (Œª i, interior (s i)) works even without the fintype assumption :hurt:

import topology.bases
open classical filter topological_space set

lemma interior_pi {Œπ : Type*} [fintype Œπ] {Œ± : Œπ ‚Üí Type*} [Œ† i, topological_space (Œ± i)]
  {I : set Œπ} {s : Œ† i, set (Œ± i)} :
  interior (pi I s) = I.pi (Œª i, interior (s i)) :=
begin
  ext a,
  simp only [mem_pi, mem_interior_iff_mem_nhds],
  split,
  { intro h,
    rw (is_topological_basis_pi (Œª i : Œπ, @is_topological_basis_opens (Œ± i) _)).mem_nhds_iff at h,
    obtain ‚ü®t, ‚ü®U, F, htopen, rfl‚ü©, H‚ÇÅ, H‚ÇÇ‚ü© := h,
    intros i hi,
    rw mem_nhds_iff,
    dsimp only [subset_def, mem_pi] at H‚ÇÇ,
    classical,
    by_cases hiF : i ‚àà F,
    { use U i,
      rw mem_pi at H‚ÇÅ,
      refine ‚ü®_, htopen i hiF, H‚ÇÅ i hiF‚ü©,
      intros x hx,
      have := H‚ÇÇ (function.update a i x) _,
      { specialize this i hi,
        simpa, },
      { intros i' hi'F,
        rw function.update,
        split_ifs,
        { convert hx,
          exact eq_rec_heq h.symm x,},
        { exact H‚ÇÅ _ hi'F, }, }, },
    { use univ,
      refine ‚ü®_, is_open_univ, mem_univ (a i)‚ü©,
      rw [univ_subset_iff, eq_univ_iff_forall],
      intro x,
      have := H‚ÇÇ (function.update a i x) _,
      { specialize this i hi,
        simpa, },
      { intros i' hi'F,
        rw function.update,
        split_ifs,
        { rw h at hi'F,
          contradiction, },
        { exact H‚ÇÅ _ hi'F, }, }, }, },
  { refine set_pi_mem_nhds (finite.of_fintype _), },
end

Ok I made that part slightly neater by explicitly making the case split I want rather than rewriting function to use split ifs, but the principle is the same:

import topology.bases
open classical filter topological_space set

lemma interior_pi {Œπ : Type*} [fintype Œπ] {Œ± : Œπ ‚Üí Type*} [Œ† i, topological_space (Œ± i)]
  {I : set Œπ} {s : Œ† i, set (Œ± i)} :
  interior (pi I s) = I.pi (Œª i, interior (s i)) :=
begin
  ext a,
  simp only [mem_pi, mem_interior_iff_mem_nhds],
  split,
  { intro h,
    rw (is_topological_basis_pi (Œª i : Œπ, @is_topological_basis_opens (Œ± i) _)).mem_nhds_iff at h,
    obtain ‚ü®t, ‚ü®U, F, htopen, rfl‚ü©, H‚ÇÅ, H‚ÇÇ‚ü© := h,
    intros i hi,
    rw mem_nhds_iff,
    dsimp only [subset_def, mem_pi] at H‚ÇÇ,
    classical,
    by_cases hiF : i ‚àà F,
    { use U i,
      rw mem_pi at H‚ÇÅ,
      refine ‚ü®_, htopen i hiF, H‚ÇÅ i hiF‚ü©,
      intros x hx,
      simpa using H‚ÇÇ (function.update a i x) _ i hi,
      intros i' hi'F,
      by_cases h : i = i',
      { subst h,
        rwa [function.update_same], },
      { rw function.update_noteq (ne.symm h),
        exact H‚ÇÅ _ hi'F, }, },
    { use univ,
      refine ‚ü®_, is_open_univ, mem_univ (a i)‚ü©,
      rw [univ_subset_iff, eq_univ_iff_forall],
      intro x,
      simpa using H‚ÇÇ (function.update a i x) _ i hi,
      intros i' hi'F,
      by_cases h : i = i',
      { subst h,
        contradiction, },
      { rw function.update_noteq (ne.symm h),
        exact H‚ÇÅ _ hi'F, }, }, },
  { refine set_pi_mem_nhds (finite.of_fintype _), },
end

I wrote the proof below, but it reminded me of very overdue stuff I needed to fix in order.filter.basis to make it a bit simpler.

import topology.constructions
open classical filter topological_space set function
open_locale topological_space

lemma Inter_ite {Œπ : Type*} {Œ± : Type*} (f g : Œπ ‚Üí set Œ±) (I : set Œπ) [decidable_pred (Œª x, x ‚àà I)]:
(‚ãÇ i, if i ‚àà I then f i else g i) = (‚ãÇ i ‚àà I, f i) ‚à© (‚ãÇ i (h : i ‚àâ I), g i) :=
begin
  ext x,
  simp,
  split,
  { intro h,
    split ;
    { intros i hi,
      simpa [hi] using h i } },
  { rintro ‚ü®h, h'‚ü© i,
    split_ifs with hi,
    exacts [h i hi, h' i hi] }
end

lemma exists_Inter_of_mem_infi {Œπ : Type*} {Œ± : Type*} {f : Œπ ‚Üí filter Œ±} {s}
  (hs : s ‚àà ‚®Ö i, f i) : ‚àÉ t : Œπ ‚Üí set Œ±, (‚àÄ i, t i ‚àà f i) ‚àß (‚ãÇ i, t i) ‚äÜ s  :=
begin
  classical,
  rcases mem_infi_iff'.mp hs with ‚ü®I, I_fin, V, hV, hV'‚ü©,
  refine ‚ü®Œª i, if i ‚àà I then V i else univ, _, _‚ü©,
  { intro i,
    split_ifs,
    exacts [hV i h, univ_mem_sets] },
  { simp [Inter_ite, hV'] },
end

lemma image_projection_prod {Œπ : Type*} {Œ± : Œπ ‚Üí Type*} {v : Œ† (i : Œπ), set (Œ± i)}
  (hv : (pi univ v).nonempty) (i : Œπ) :
  (Œª (x : Œ† (i : Œπ), Œ± i), x i) '' (‚ãÇ k, (Œª (x : Œ† (j : Œπ), Œ± j), x k) ‚Åª¬π' v k) = v i:=
begin
  classical,
  apply subset.antisymm,
  { simp [Inter_subset] },
  { intros y y_in,
    simp only [mem_image, mem_Inter, mem_preimage],
    rcases hv with ‚ü®z, hz‚ü©,
    refine ‚ü®function.update z i y, _, update_same i y z‚ü©,
    rw @forall_update_iff Œπ Œ± _ z i y (Œª i t, t ‚àà v i),
    exact ‚ü®y_in, Œª j hj, by simpa using hz j‚ü© },
end

lemma pi_mem_nhds {Œπ : Type*} {Œ± : Œπ ‚Üí Type*} [Œ† (i : Œπ), topological_space (Œ± i)]
  {I : set Œπ} {s : Œ† i, set (Œ± i)} (a : Œ† i, Œ± i) (hs : I.pi s ‚àà ùìù a) {i : Œπ} (hi : i ‚àà I) :
  s i ‚àà ùìù (a i) :=
begin
  set p := Œª i, Œª (x : Œ† (i : Œπ), Œ± i), x i,
  rw [nhds_pi, pi_def] at hs,
  obtain ‚ü®t : Œπ ‚Üí set (Œ† i, Œ± i),
          ht : ‚àÄ i, t i ‚àà comap (p i) (ùìù (a i)), ht' : (‚ãÇ (i : Œπ), t i) ‚äÜ ‚ãÇ i ‚àà I, p i ‚Åª¬π' s i‚ü© :=
    exists_Inter_of_mem_infi hs,
  simp only [exists_prop, mem_comap_sets] at ht,
  choose v hv hv' using ht,
  apply mem_sets_of_superset (hv i),
  have : (‚ãÇ i, p i ‚Åª¬π' v i) ‚äÜ p i ‚Åª¬π' s i,
    from ((Inter_subset_Inter hv').trans ht').trans (bInter_subset_of_mem hi),
  rwa [‚Üê image_subset_iff, image_projection_prod] at this,
  use a,
  rw [mem_univ_pi],
  exact Œª j, mem_of_mem_nhds (hv j)
end

lemma pi_mem_nhds_iff {Œπ : Type*} [fintype Œπ] {Œ± : Œπ ‚Üí Type*} [Œ† (i : Œπ), topological_space (Œ± i)]
  {I : set Œπ} {s : Œ† i, set (Œ± i)} (a : Œ† i, Œ± i) :
  I.pi s ‚àà ùìù a ‚Üî ‚àÄ (i : Œπ), i ‚àà I ‚Üí s i ‚àà ùìù (a i) :=
‚ü®by apply pi_mem_nhds, set_pi_mem_nhds $ finite.of_fintype I‚ü©

lemma interior_pi {Œπ : Type*} [fintype Œπ] {Œ± : Œπ ‚Üí Type*} [Œ† i, topological_space (Œ± i)]
  {I : set Œπ} {s : Œ† i, set (Œ± i)} :
  interior (pi I s) = I.pi (Œª i, interior (s i)) :=
by { ext a, simp only  [mem_pi, mem_interior_iff_mem_nhds, pi_mem_nhds_iff] }
Note that the goal was not to reduce the total number of lines, but to get the lemmas that should be there.
Note in particular how your function.update issue was not lack of API but Lean 3 being bad at unifying the motive in forall_update_iff

(Œª (x : Œ† (i : Œπ), Œ± i), x i) '' (‚ãÇ k, (Œª (x : Œ† (j : Œπ), Œ± j), x k) ‚Åª¬π' v k) = v i:=

as 

(function.eval i) '' (‚ãÇ k, function.eval k ‚Åª¬π' v k) = v i:=

(docs#function.eval)
I know this exists but in this context the name is really confusing. Here we really thing of it as a projection, not an evaluation.
That contention between eval and proj has come up elsewhere too; we have docs#pi.eval_add_monoid_hom but docs#linear_map.proj.
